instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
Hi,
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image that has no image on internal display, but it has image on external monitor. Alreay tried a known good display and good lcd cable, but same result.
Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
Any history available, liquid sign near LCD connector?
Missing backlight and image too?
Check diode mode to ground on video data lines, especially AUX channel.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
Hi,
The client says that it stoped working by it self.
I think that I don't have backlight, becausei get 0V on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> (<CAPACITOR>C8500</CAPACITOR>).
I can't identify witch are the  video data lines. Can you, please, specify them?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
"I can't identify witch are the  video data lines"
What about EDP_INT_ lines?
3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> present at least in the first seconds (when chime)?
If yes, <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> goes high at same time?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
Thanks.
When measuring, I notice that on cap was shorted (<CAPACITOR>C8460</CAPACITOR>). After replacement it worked.
Tks
